required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multidisciplinary Treatment of Obesity Prior to in Vitro Fertilization: Impact on Global Reproductive Outcomes (PRO-FIV Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Multidisciplinary Treatment of Obesity Prior to In Vitro Fertilization: Impact on Global Reproductive Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the present study is to evaluate the impact of a multidisciplinary treatment of obesity prior to IVF on global reproductive outcomes and maternofetal metabolic and cardiovascular risk factors.
This is a randomized controlled trial in obese infertile women before starting an IVF cycle. The intervention is based on a structured multidisciplinary program in support groups, which includes diet, physical activity and psychological therapy. IVF will be started immediately after this therapy. Patients included in the control group will start an IVF cycle immediately after the randomization. The results of this study may allow the identification of patients who would benefit from obesity treatment, so as to establish appropriate preventive and therapeutic strategies and to reduce the maternal obesity impact in future generations.

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of the present study is to evaluate the impact of a multidisciplinary treatment of obesity prior to IVF on global reproductive outcomes and maternofetal metabolic and cardiovascular risk factors.
This is a randomized controlled trial in obese infertile women (body mass index â‰¥30 kg/m2) before starting an IVF cycle. In the intervention group, the aim is a weight loss of at least 10% in a 16-week period of treatment based on a multidisciplinary approach and support groups, which includes diet, physical activity and psychological therapy. IVF will be started immediately after this period. Patients included in the control group will start an IVF cycle immediately after the randomization. The results of this study may allow the identification of patients who would benefit from obesity treatment, so as to establish appropriate preventive and therapeutic strategies and to reduce the maternal obesity impact in future generations.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized controlled trial including 2 arms: intervention group and control group.

primary_outcome.measure: live birth rate of a healthy baby in a non-complicated pregnancy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 months after starting the IVF treatment
primary_outcome.description: live birth rate in a pregnancy without major complications: gestational diabetes, hypertensive disorders, preterm delivery, congenital anomalies, stillbirth, neonatal death, shoulder dystocia, maternal venous thromboembolism, fetal growth abnormal outcomes (macrosomia, large for gestational age, intrauterine growth restriction)

secondary_outcome.description: weight change during intervention, measured in kilograms

secondary_outcome.measure: anthropometric parameters: body mass index - BMI (kilograms/metro2)
secondary_outcome.description: BMI change during intervention, measured as kilograms/metro2
abdominal circumference change during intervention measured in centimeters

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years (simultaneous analysis of all the biological samples)
secondary_outcome.description: AMH serum levels before the intervention (intervention group) and before the IVF (2 arms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years (simultaneous analysis of all the biological samples)
secondary_outcome.description: insulin serum levels before the intervention (intervention group) and before the IVF (2 arms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years (simultaneous analysis of all the biological samples)
secondary_outcome.description: leptin serum levels before the intervention (intervention group) and before the IVF (2 arms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years (simultaneous analysis of all the biological samples)
secondary_outcome.description: adiponectin serum levels before the intervention (intervention group) and before the IVF (2 arms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years (simultaneous analysis of all the biological samples)
secondary_outcome.description: ghrelin serum levels before the intervention (intervention group) and before the IVF (2 arms)
cycle cancellation rate: cancelled cycles/ initiated cycles
total gonadotropin doses used in the IVF stimulation protocol
number of oocytes retrieved
total number of embryos obtained in 2 pronuclear stage

secondary_outcome.measure: IVF outcomes: number of good quality embryos
secondary_outcome.description: number of good quality embryos (type A and B) obtained in the cleavage stage
clinical pregnancy rate: clinical pregnancies/started cycles
miscarriage rate: miscarriages/clinical pregnancies
fetal ultrasound and Doppler parameters at 28-32 weeks of gestation. All parameters are measured according to the current guidelines and reported as quantitative measurements.

secondary_outcome.measure: postpartum anthropometric outcomes: maternal abdominal circumference (centimeters)
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal abdominal circumference in centimeters 1 month and 12 months after the delivery
Maternal weight in kilograms 1 month and 12 months after the delivery
neonatal weight in grams 1 month and 12 months after the delivery
neonatal height in centimeters 1 month and 12 months after the delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: postpartum anthropometric outcomes: neonatal skin fold measurements (millimeters)
secondary_outcome.description: neonatal skin fold measurements in millimeters 1 month and 12 months after the delivery

intervention.description: Lifestyle counseling coupled with psychotherapeutical intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese infertile patients (body mass index â‰¥ 30 Kg/m2) prior to an in vitro fertilization cycle
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pathological conditions: diabetes type I, Cushing syndrome, premature ovarian failure, uncontrolled thyroidal dysfunction, hepatic and/or renal dysfunction, antiphospholipid syndrome, medical condition that contraindicate ovarian stimulation and/or pregnancy
- Simultaneous practice of another strategy to lose weight
- Physical conditions limiting exercise training
- Patients unable to understand spanish language or to give informed consent
